Author: akinamai
Text: Honestly I think at that point the move is just to be point blank “please don’t comment on my body” and if they get defensive just say like “I’m not attacking you I’m just asking you to not do that again please” and then refuse to engage beyond that if they keep trying to defend themselves. It’s totally within your rights not to want people to comment on your body, and it is very much their problem if they can’t respect an extremely basic and polite request. (Also ps I have found a trick for dealing w these types of comments is actually to NOT explain yourself at all, just firmly ask them to stop and don’t follow up w “because it makes me uncomfortable” or anything, you don’t owe an explanation for a simple request AND it doesn’t put you on the defensive.)
